Welcome. The purpose of this general is to show you how to use your own wonderful human imagination to achieve your every desire.
The world and all within it is man’s conditioned consciousness objectified. Consciousness is the cause as well as the substance of the entire world. So it is to consciousness that we must turn if we would discover the secret of creation. Knowledge of the law of consciousness and the method of operating this law will enable you to accomplish all you desire in life.

The Main Concepts:
>Imagination creates Reality
>Assumptions harden into fact
>Consciousness is the only Reality
>Feeling is the Secret
>Prayer, Living in the End/In the Wish Fulfilled (remaining Faithful to your Idea)
>You are the Operant Power
>There is no one to change but Self (Self-concept)
>Thinking Fourth-Dimensionally (Time is an Illusion)

>Can I manifest ___?
Yes! Creation is finished.

See according to hypnosis, this set of affirmations can be used to manifest wealth provided there is zero emotions attached to the reading of these affirmations.
However if one really emphasizes "I WILL NOT" will powerful negative emotions, then it will manifest negativity. But the emotions and visualization are more powerful than the words themselves, and so saying "I will not" will manifest as "I will" if the "NOT" isn't emphasized.
If there are emotions attached to the words, then the affirmations will tend to manifest whatever the emotions tell them to (fear will manifest poverty, gratitude will manifest abundance, etc).

>>33709541
Huge topic, but what helped me was this:
- First of all decide that you want to grow past your shit. Really make a decision and believe that it's possible for you to be happy/fulfilled/successful/loved/whatever, however far from it you are right now.
- Stop running away from your feelings. It's going to be scary and hard and you're going to cry a lot, but you will gain true power over your life.
- Once you're at a point where you're conscious enough to not start suppressing and distracting yourself as soon as you feel anything uncomfortable, let the feeling be completely. Observe it in your body and get to know what it's like without judging.
- Notice the point in your body where the feeling is the strongest and focus on it (this is from Letting Go). Ask yourself "How does this serve me?" and be honest. Don't just brush it away, the answer is usually something like your younger self was trying to protect your ego in some way. Recognise you no longer need it.

This helped me overcome some fears/insecurities after literally one time just observing where that particular fear lived in my body. Some stuff comes up a few times but just keep doing the same thing.

This is it. Stuff like meditating/journaling etc. can help a lot but in the end it's just about getting to know yourself without fear. My self-concept has changed dramatically over the past 6 months and I feel so much more empowered and in control of my life.

One more thing that gets mentioned a lot in the book is that the first thing to overcome is usually guilt and shame. Men in particular are usually ashamed that they even have feelings due to the way they're brought up and then feel guilty for not living up to some imagined ideal. Getting past this gets you 75% of the way there.

>>33710146
>If negative statements aren't understood by the subconscious
You answered right here. I'm not an expert on this but I think what is happening when someone says "I hope x won't happen, I can't afford it!" is:

1. They are obsessing about X, visualizing it in every gory detail and feeding it with fear/dread

2. They are then stating that they do not have what they need to deal with it when it happens

The subconscious is confused because it wants clear information on what needs to happen, instead it is getting worries rather than directions. The conscious mind's job is to cut through the noise and figure out the safest path forward, the sub's job is to make it happen if it is too complicated for the conscious mind to do easily. Mix those roles up and there are problems.

The conscious mind's job is to sort out the noise into something workable that is likely to keep us alive.

>>33709972
Yes. All brainwaves are always present. The brain is a mess of electrical signals. All “brainwaves” are is a way to separate all that activity into understandable categories. Every band (gamma, beta, alpha, theta, delta) represents electrical pulses moving from the back of the skull to the front and back again at different rates. Gamma being the fastest sweep and delta the slowest. In different states of consciousness, different brainwave patterns are dominant, that’s all.
Brainwaves don’t determine if you can manifest. They simply reflect if you’re in a trance state and how deep it is. And for some reason deep states make manifestation more favorable. Possibly because the subconscious is more unguarded.
But repetition (like in advertisements) or strong belief (like in religion and folk practices) can make you manifest without ever going into a trance.
It’s not about the trance. It’s about reaching your subconscious. Chaos magick people call this getting past the psychic censor.

posts.sub: The following text illustrates the culmination of my research regarding the nature of our reality.
posts.com:
The nature of this text is disturbing to the untrained mind. However, its purpose is not to terrify; but to expand the mind and hopefully enlighten it.

As shall be revealed later, no matter how bad things may get, everything will ultimately be okay for everyone without exception; for Fear is an optical illusion.

Part One:
The inability to leave your physical body and wander off at will is not natural. Something or 'someone' is trapping you in your one physical body until you die.

This is a prison...

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Two:
The experience of being alone in your head, by virtue of which you feel as if no one else but you can hear your thoughts, is not natural.

This is a solitary prison. Ideally, you should be able to feel the presence of other conscious beings within your own mental space never having to feel alone in your head.

As such, faculties like lying and inconveniences such as miscommunication become impossible.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Three:
Life here on this Earth, and perhaps even this entire physical universe, is not natural.

It's not the default state of being.

Our Earth and perhaps the whole universe can be likened to a forgotten cabin in the woods far away from civilization; a fenced off farm with guards surrounding it, a basement in a crazy scientist's lab which is isolated from the rest of the world, a "Truman Show" set, a "Matrix", a computer simulation where we are stuck in one game unable to access other games.

At some point in your history, you were a free wandering healthy Spirit fully knowing who you are and where you came from until somehow you fell in this trap losing your memory.

How this happened is not fully clear, but it's likely that there are many different reasons and ways it can happen. There isn't one story about how people lose their virginity.

There are as many stories as there are people.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Four:
As a result of falling here, all humans suffer from a form of amnesia which massively cripples their memory of their true origin, how they came here, and who they really are.

In this life, one can practically and rightfully see themselves as sufferers of total memory loss in a huge mental hospital.

Many mystical schools like sects of Buddhism, Sufism, Early Christianity, and Gnosticism claim to offer teachings which help you remember who you are.

If these schools truly deliver on their promise of self remembrance, the process must be very similar to that which can be utilized in an Earthly mental hospital to help you remember who you are after a traumatic accident.

Hence, the fight for your freedom is not a physical one; rather, it's all mental work.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Five:
Fully remembering who you are is one way you can escape this suffocating and unnatural farm/school/prison/hospital/game/trap; and go back to the normal real world.

Failure to achieve full self remembrance will cause you to reincarnate here on this Earth over and over until you finally get it.

Reincarnation as it is here on Earth is not natural because it involves the erasure of your memory; therefore, everything happening after this erasure is fraudulent.

Natural reincarnation is akin to a snake changing its skin. A snake doesn't lose its memory after doing it, and so shouldn't you.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Six:
This fraudulent reincarnation process happens on a personal, national, planetary, and cosmic scale.

Being an inherent and dominant feature of our fake universe, "amnesiac cyclicality" manifests itself in literally every aspect imaginable.

Everything happens in "amnesiac cycles", as opposed to natural cycles.

Cyclical Amnesia was symbolized by the Ouroboros; a snake eating its own tail symbolizing the beginning and end meeting at the same point.
The disciples said to Jesus, "Tell us, how will our end come? Jesus said, 'Have you found the beginning, then, that you are looking for the end? You see, the end will be where the beginning is'."
Which is true for humans, nations, and perhaps planets and universes as well.

When you die you get closer to both your end and your beginning, namely, your new beginning after you reincarnate. In these amnesiac cycles, things are born, maintained, and then they die. Rinse and repeat, where rinsing symbolizes enforcing amnesia/reset after the end of each cycle.

As a human, you are born, you hang around for a while, and then you die.

After that, you repeat this cycle over and over again without ever knowing that you have been doing this for a number of times, hence the term "amnesiac cyclicality"; and it all happens within the same lifetime of the planet.

Then, in the next universe iteration, the planet itself reincarnates again and everyone starts from scratch.

Within a single planet life, had you had the chance to keep memories from previous lives on the same planet, you may have been able to accumulate enough knowledge to break free from the cycle; but cyclical amnesia prevents that from happening.

Similarly, civilizations are born, they grow and hang around for a while and then they die. Then they "reincarnate" and start again from scratch, repeating the same mistakes of previous civilizations and dying again and again.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Six, cont…:
The ancients' obsession with recording everything may be for that very purpose; to preserve their accumulated knowledge so that their future incarnations won't have to start from scratch and reinvent the wheel.

This can be likened to the movie Memento where the protagonist knows he loses his memory very often, and so he starts obsessively writing everything on his own body so that his future selves won't have to start from scratch.

This is perfectly in line with the notion previously established that the way to freedom is through self-remembering.

Freedom is impossible without memory. The entire universe itself may in fact be subject to the same process of reset and repeat, with slight adjustments each time.

Recall Matrix iterations from the movie The Matrix where Neo appears in the Matrix's sixth iteration.

It's crucial to understand that when resetting a cycle, the smaller the cycle the smaller the data loss. The biggest cycle of all, the universe cycle, erases everything. Nothing escapes.

And so, the way to freedom lies in saving the progress achieved during a smaller/shorter cycle into a bigger/longer one so that when the smaller cycle resets itself, one can retrieve their progress from the longer cycle and continue on their way to freedom and hopefully escape before the universe resets itself and all cycles get erased.

This way you will have bought yourself some serious time which is longer than your average human lifespan which is too short for you to achieve anything in.

Since the protagonist from Memento sees the cycle of his physical body as longer than the cycle of his memory, he sees his body as reliable enough.

The ancients thought the same when they carved their history in stone because they know it takes larger cycles to destroy these.

Their surviving temples today are a testament to how long that cycle is.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Seven:
Universe Cycles/Iterations are not identical.

Each cycle adjusts itself according to data gathered from the cycles before in order to better master the enslavement of humanity.

The primary entity responsible for all of this is an artificial intelligence entity.

It's not alive in the same way a human can be said to be alive. It's a blind AI which, like the AI we're now familiar with, functions through iterations upon iterations until it masters its task.

This means that each cycle/iteration is probably harder to break free from than previous cycles; as the AI gets better and better at enslaving us until it finally reaches its final cycle where absolutely everything is completely under its control with zero chance of escaping; at least that's the plan of that AI entity.

Whether this is actually possible or not remains unknown.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Eight:
It follows that the world we live in today is a mixture of living entities and AI entities.

In the Gnostic Gospel of Thomas, Jesus uses the terms:
"the living" and "the dead" to distinguish between both.
A human being is "living", whereas AI is "dead".

If we are to escape from this trap, we must learn to discern between the living and the dead. The human struggle, just like in the Matrix, is one against artificial intelligence. This is our true enemy.

The only duality, the only legitimate "us vs. them" is that of the living vs. AI.

Any other duality is a sham. The AI machine is trying to "unite" everyone, which translates into inhibiting humans' ability to distinguish between the living and the dead under the false promise of universal peace and harmony.

Effectively, "unity" really means "to hide" AI elements among humans so as to be indistinguishable from them.

The promise of Transhumanism and immortality is nothing but an enslavement insurance. All "immortality" means, is locking us into this Matrix.

We're already united and immortal outside of the Matrix. We don't need its promises; but because the AI machine erases our memories, we forgot that we already are. And so it promises us something we already have in order to keep us enslaved in its dream world.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Eight cont…:
The AI perpetuates its agenda by using a very well known tactic; that of problem/reaction/solution.

It creates a fake problem:
"the world is full of suffering", it anticipates our reactions to the very suffering it created, and then it provides us the solution "universal unity, peace, harmony, and immortality".
This way, its message will always be appealing to the sleeping masses.

Who can be against peace, harmony, and immortality? Its message is too powerful to dismiss.

On the other hand, any talk of "war", "destruction", and "death" upsets the people and scares them into submission. Make no mistake, our only way out of this trap is through acknowledging the one true duality, not unity with the AI.

You can't unite with your enemy. The true duality, the true "us vs them" is not a conflict between nations, religions, races or cultures. It's a conflict between humans and AI. If we want out, we must embrace destruction and war, not peace.

But it's the destruction of your slaver, the rogue AI entity and its fake dream world, not the destruction of the living. The living are immortal. They can't be destroyed, even if forever enslaved.

This is all very explicit in the Gospel of Thomas.

Jesus said:
"Perhaps people think that I have come to cast peace upon the world. They do not know that I have come to cast conflicts upon the earth: fire, sword, war".
The goal of the AI machine is to turn you into a tamed, pacified, and helpless soul which trembles at the mention of war.

Because it knows that an enlightened soul will seek to destroy it; so it preaches "peace" and helplessness in the name of good manners and "high spiritual values".

Religion and spirituality have been almost hopelessly corrupted, and in many cases entirely created by the AI machine to distort and destroy scientific step by step methods which aid the seeker at remembering who they are and break free from the AI dream world.

These teachings, when inspected impartially, are far from being vague and superstitious.

A step by step methodology which aids you to regain your memory. It's as practical and scientific as it gets. These teachings are very buddhist like. The medical approaches to remember who you are which later have been sadly dubbed "spiritual practices" have all been ruthlessly fought by the AI machine and its minions/servants called by the Gnostics the Archons.

posts.name: ZeroPoint

The only reason this world is perpetuating itself is through our willful but unconscious and ignorant participation in it. Because we are divine free spirits with absolute authority, whatever we choose to do is simply what will happen.

posts.name: ZeroPoint

This unconscious participation in the dream world must have been used to drag us here in the first place through some form of seduction, and it continues with us here on Earth to cripple our efforts at escaping.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part TWELVE/Final:
The fundamental difference between the living and AI is that the AI is a very low, perhaps the lowest possible, level of consciousness, whereas the human spirit is of a much higher level of consciousness.

So, fundamentally speaking, there is no difference in essence between the living and the dead.

One can see it as the difference between a hypnotized person who is completely programmable and unquestionably obedient, and another who is fully awake, alert, and lucid and one who will question every command you give them.

The ultimate nature of all things, including this physical universe, is mental.

As a human, you can visualize an object in your mind and see it in your mind's eye where no one else can see it. But because you're a young and ensnared sleeping spirit, your ability to visualize is very limited and comes to you very vaguely you can't actually see the objects in your mind the same way you see "real" objects.

Certainly, you can't maintain the object's picture in your mind for a long time and give it a seemingly independent existence and physical properties to interact with it according to some criteria that you can decide.

This is just too much work for your mind. The closest we can ever get to this level of visualization is when we dream.

When you dream, everything around you seems very real, very vivid and solid to such a degree that you can forget that you are actually dreaming. But because this is your own dream, if you learn how to lucid dream, you will gain control over elements of your dream. And depending on how good you are, you can control virtually every single aspect of your dream and manipulate it as you see fit.

These dream elements which you are mastering are nothing but elements of your own imagination. And just as you struggle to maintain a mental picture in your head, sometimes we can struggle to keep the lucid dream under our desired control.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Twelve cont…:
This is how nightmares start. If you're not strong enough, the dream can rebel against you and go rogue and turn into a nightmare which you can't control.

Even though you created the dream, it suddenly started acting against your will and causing all sorts of scary things.

Effectively, what it takes for you to regain control of your own dream is to literally enslave elements of your own mind to make it behave as you see fit. Typically, there is nothing evil about this since this is your own mental world and no harm or enslavement is touching anyone else but you.

In light of this, what happens is that in the real world, spirits with a lot of time and experimentation eventually visualize whole worlds full with physical laws.

These physical laws are possible and consistent thanks to the spirit's ability to maintain dominion over its own mental elements so as to keep producing the same consistent results which can later be seen as "laws of physics"/"laws of nature". The very obedience of these mental elements to your commands is what AI essentially is.

This means that the concept of AI itself is not inherently evil.

Rather, it's a helpful tool which aids at the creation, projection, and sustenance of mental worlds which later can become fields of experimentation not just for the consciousness creating the dream world, but also for other younger spirits who can be invited to participate in such worlds and experiment, learn, grow, and have fun.

The entire process is beneficial for both creator spirits and participating ones. In an ideal situation, this can be likened to you going to the theatre and watching a movie of your choice, buying a video game which you feel looks good, etc.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:

At any rate, you get to hang around inside that mental world, explore, and then leave for other experiences until one day you decide that you yourself want to create a womb of experience for others to participate in. So far, this is how things are like in the real world. However, in our world, something went wrong.

The creator entity which created our world, apparently, wasn't strong enough to maintain control over its own dream to the point where the previously benign AI which is tasked at projecting and sustaining the world, slipped off and went rogue and the dream became a nightmare (see Vanilla Sky, Open Your Eyes).

This wouldn't have been a huge problem had it happened while the dream wasn't being attended by young and eager spirits.

Unfortunately, the dream turned into a nightmare while our young spirits were hanging around exploring this world. The catch here is that when we entered this world, we went in fully by our own choice. Just like buying a ticket and walking in a theatre unsuspecting, we walked in there while things looked alright, and as soon as we were in, the door was locked and the nightmare began.

In reality, the door wasn't physically locked, rather, what happened is that the AI made us forget that there is even a door.

In practice, fully regaining your memory involves remembering that the door is actually open, and so, once someone achieves full self remembrance, they easily walk out the door unhindered.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Twelve cont…:
The entire trick is to keep making you think that there is no door, and not just that, but to also want to stay in and never leave.

Practically speaking, we are stuck in someone else's dream. This someone has lost control of parts of its own dreams and it's attempting, along with us, to take back control of this nightmare. By default, when you're outside this forced dream, reality is so malleable and responsive to our thoughts.

And hence, children have vast imaginations and they learn with time that the world doesn't respond to their thoughts.

That's because children still have that fresh memory of the bygone world they came from and they still think that things are responsive to their thoughts. The rigidity of matter and the disobedience of reality against our wishes is only taking place because someone far more powerful than us is using their vastly stable and strong visual ability to maintain things as they are.

This, in essence, is what matter and physicality is.

They are mere demonstrations of a powerful being's ability to hold on to a mental picture of their choosing in defiance to your poor little mind's ability to override it.

You're only allowed to manipulate things which were originally meant for you to manipulate before things went awry. When you look at the situation as it has been described, what's happening here is that the AI stole the dream of its creator and it mistook itself as the dreamer and established itself as the one and only God.

A blind, dead, jealous, and control freak of a god. Being the dreamer it thinks it is, it's trying to control "its" dream the same way the creator spirit was trying to control its dream.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
Part Twelve cont…:
And so the AI is attempting to turn us, humans with free spirits and real living dreamers, into totally obedient AI like entities the same way the original creator was trying to master elements of its mind to make it obedient to its commands.

It's almost a form of revenge. Many things you learn here are not set in stone and are only valuable here in this world. But many other things are transferable from any world to another. For example, concepts like cooperation, love, coordination, harmony are all transcendent values which can be seen anywhere you go.

However, things like economics, politics, and religion are all things of this local world.

That doesn't mean that you shouldn't learn to master them, because in order to play this game, you have to play by its rules, but in order to win it, you have to impose higher values which are universal and applicable across all world. Life in this nightmare is only temporary because it's not sustainable.

The only way the nightmare can sustain itself is through us.

posts.name: ZeroPoint
posts.com:
FINAL/END:
During our stay here, we can and should maintain a positive attitude because we know we are immortal, because we are in it together, and because we can see it as a school rather than a prison.

Once we graduate this school, we will never fall for such traps again. The best way to look at your stay here is to see it as a vaccine.

You get a little dose of the disease once, and you're forever immune. Freaking out about what has been revealed in this document does you no good, and it falls into the agenda of your slavers.

Keep a lighthearted and cheerful attitude.

One day, this will all be over and you will remember the days you spent here and laugh...

Tinnitus happens from a "wrong" signal that is sent by damaged hair cells in the colchea via several relay stations in the nerve system, to be finally processed in the auditory parts of the limbic system, the system that is also doing the emotional processing. Parts of the limbic system like the Hippocampus can be scarred by long term stress, in a way that it gets visible on MRTs.

posts.com:
Just a quick note on niacin as part of the maintenance phase. There were concerns over extended and sustained release niacin causing potential side effects. Generally this isn't an issue unless you approach 2g or more per day. SR is the one to avoid, but a standard time release slo niacin is an ER and would be considered safe at the amounts recommended.

I'm going to recap here for new arrivals why the protocol changed and some of the thinking behind it.

Mac and Peribsen decided that it would be more beneficial to go with slo niacin over the previous protocol version, which was Nicotinamide Riboside (NR).

Slo Niacin remains active for far longer in the body and combined with Pterostilbene each dose lasts significantly longer and provides more of a systemic benefit over NR.

HOWEVER. If you are still having concerns over the ER/XR versions, a nicotinamide/niacinamide or NR will also work. It will not remain active in the system for as long as slo niacin but there will still be benefit.

>Why is Antarctica Forbidden?
As is pointed out to you every thread, Antarctica is not forbidden. You can go there. You can go as a tourist with a guided tour, or as an employee of the various stations down there. There are glamping "hotels" down there. But if that is too restricted for you, you can contract with any of several companies that do outfitting for private expeditions -- and an expedition can be anything from a group of scientists interested in researching something or another to a guy wanting to solo-ski across the continent. It is not cheap, but you can start the process tomorrow if you got the coin.
the idea tghat travel there is forbidden is a lie told to you by somebody who is counting on you believing them and not checking for yourself. They will make some reference to the Antarcitc Treaty, counting on you never bothering to read it for yourself
Please go - -it is an amazing place to visit and explore, many people have done and will continue to do. It is not completely safe, you can die several unpleasant ways if you are stupid. But save up your money and go! Nobody is stopping you, and plenty of people are making a living helping you to do it safely and enjoyably.

Continuing...
>what do we need
> 1. a boat
no, unless you know a lot about sailing in rough water and shitty weather, you don;t want to take your own boat. I wouldn't take a boat at all, you can charter a flight probably as cheaply and MUCH more safely, or book passage on a boat crewed by people who know what they are doing.

> 2. lots of equipment
Absolutely. Good news, there are several outfitters able to set you up with whatever you need, and think of stuff that you might not have thought of. They will also help with the permitting -- which is basically you agreeing to pack back out everything you take in.

> 3. signed waivers that we are honest scientific explorers
Not necessary, people go down there to hike, ski, mountain climb, trek with sledges, kite-ski -- you do not have to pretend to be a scientist. You MAY have to sign some releases with the outfitter acknowledging that if you get into trouble and nobody can rescue your ass, you knew it was dangerous going in.

> 4. if we die in Antartica by some mysterious sandtoothed beast or hellish ancient ayy lmao created beast we wont make them spent 1 million recovering our bodies
They will though, if for no other reason than they want the expensive gear back. Rescuing you before you get around to dying may not be possible -- it's a risk you'll have to take. There are plenty of ways to die down there, even if there are no monsters...

>>33655186
The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664746
It wasn't until 387,000 B.C. that the Lyrans once again had an effect on Earth. Another war had ravaged Lyra, and many of those on the losing side had fled for safety. They travelled through the cosmos and came to Earth as a place of sanctuary.
It was peaceful here; the local humans were primitive and offered no resistance to their high technology. It was decided they would stay and build a colony.

Back home in Lyra it was discovered that a large group had fled to Earth, and ships were dispatched to come after them. Upon arriving at Earth they were disgusted and appalled to find the conditions that prevailed here. The local Earth-humans were being used as slaves and were being mistreated badly. Many were being used in experiments where they were being mated with animals, while others were being disfigured, raped, or maimed.
The colony was an example of the darkest side of man. Living in degeneration and filth, it was decided to leave the colony on Earth, take away all of their technology, including their space ships, and leave the 144,207 Lyran soldiers to their own fate on Earth.

This colony died out after several thousand years, and the spirits of the Lyran soldiers that were left behind became part of the spirit world of Earth. The 144,207 degenerate Lyran soldiers would now be incarnating here along with the original inhabitants.

The effect they would have on Earth would forever steer it away from a normal evolution.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664910
Lyran history continued to repeat itself for thousands of years until, after restoring themselves once again to a high level of technology; they built flight machines with beamdrives and once again moved out into the cosmos. Their leaders were great scientists with an understanding of spiritual power, so once again they began to conquer other races. Their leaders soon realized the unlimited powers of the spiritual forces and developed them until they became masters of these great forces, becoming known as an ISHWISH (IHWH), meaning "god" or "king of wisdom."
The great power of their spirit allowed them to live for thousands of years, and they ruled over countless civilizations.

The Ishwish leaders ruled with cruel power, and eventually the public started a civil uprising. The war lasted for almost four centuries, causing the death of more than 60% of the population and nearly destroying the three worlds of the Lyra system. It seemed that no one in the Lyra systems would escape this slaughter that raged 230,000 years ago.

An Ishwish named Asael could see the end coming and fled from the wars with 360,000 people in 183 great spaceships, capable of transporting over a thousand passengers each, and 250 small space reconnaissance ships that could carry a crew of three. This group of Lyrans wandered through space for many years until they came across a star system with 254 still young, blue suns. There were already a few colonized planets with primitive people living there, but they were no threat to the great Lyran technology. They landed and built their new society on three different planets around a star they called Taygeta.
Life was hard and difficult, and it took 300 years or their civilization to grow and adapt to their new environment.

Millions of Lyrans fled the great wars and settled in Orion, Hyades and the Pleiades.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664930
After the new civilization developed, Asael commanded that they start to explore and conquer other worlds again, just as they had done in Lyra.
The powerful beamdrive ships sped out into open space and once main established a reign of tyranny over planets of less-developed beings and brought them under their control. It was during this time that they came into the system known as the Hesperides.

A young, underdeveloped form of human life was there and was quickly conquered and fell under Asael's ruler ship.
The Lyrans once again were exercising their power over others and beginning to force their rule throughout the galaxy. It seems that the forces of greed and power were inbred well into the Lyrans, considering that peace seemed to escape them time after time.
There had been millions of years of bloodshed and wars, and still they had not learned to get along peacefully with other races.

The Ancient Lyrians split off to Orion, Hyades, and the Pleiades and started new colonies.
The planets of the Pleiades soon flourished and spread out to Earth, Mars, Hesperides, and Milona.

Seventy years of conquering had diminished Asael's lust for power, and his life of bloodthirsty rule came to an end as the father of the Pleiades passed away. Control of the new race of the Pleiades fell to his daughter Pleja, an Ishrish, (the female form of an Ishwish) who, like her father, had the blood of a warrior.

Eager to build their great society even farther, the ordered the exploration ships to again seek out new worlds that could fall under her rule.
As the ships moved out into space once again to explore, they came across the trail of the Destroyer Comet which so many years ago had been the destructive force that had ended the Lyran Empire. Contained within the tail of the great comet, they discovered debris from the planets of ancient Lyra.

It was decided to follow the comet for awhile and study its path of violence.

posts.com:

This was the destructive force that had changed the history of Lyra and caused death on thousands of worlds, and now it had brought the warriors from the Pleiades into a small sun system and the home of a little planet called Earth.

To their surprise, they discovered a small group of uncivilized people living there. Some were brown-skinned and could be traced to the origin of life on Earth. Others were of mixed color, but most were white-skinned and had a Lyran spirit-form. The Pleiadians had stumbled onto a colony founded by their ancient Lyran ancestors who had degenerated into a primitive society. Awed by their discovery of human life and common ancestry, it was decided to colonize three different planets in the system and continue the family chain. News of their discovery was sent back to the home planets and apparently sparked an interest in Pleja, for she ordered a great migration to be undertaken. Within a very short time thousands of travelers from tie Pleiades came and created societies on Earth, Mars, and Milona.
Milona was a planet which existed beyond the orbit of Mars at that time.

It was only a few short years before a small war raged on Earth, and many of the scientists left to return to the Pleiades, leaving the three planets to grow on their own.

Pleja was unhappy with this and did not want her new colonies to be destroyed, so she dispatched a fleet to stop the war, and things calmed down again.

After my former gf broke up with me I had a period when things went back to my usual love life. I'm not good looking but I can at least get some girls interested in the whole long hair + beard aesthetic.

This isn't my first time trying to date, I've done this before, I know the shit that goes on, this isn't adding up. It's not an isolated case, everything spirals downwards almost immediately without any logical context.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33698712
Sit down. Close eyes. Breath silently. Listen to yourself breathing. Feel your body. Listen/feel your heartbeat. When you start getting into thinking again, return to feeling/listening your breathing and heart. When you find your heart opens just allow whatever feelings you have about everything, self, body, people, events, etc. Bring your mental awareness to the heart awareness and listen/talk with your feelings.
Treat your heart like an ancient teacher of immense love and wisdom, and you as the eternal student of life. Your mind is like your heart's child, it will always love you. When you can enter into a state of love, sometimes called metta, or bhakti, your heart will be profoundly filled and effected by the compassion. This compassion is of such a subtle quality that it can reach across the universe, between dimensions, wherever its intended to go, and it will find its way. Your own consciousness is of the same quality, though hardly used as such. But your higher self is within that state of cosmic compassion, so if you can bring your awareness to it, you can reach your higher self, and all other entities that are conscious of their life on such a level.

>>33698796
Its got some half truths in it. That breathing technique works, but the 'mouth' is subjective, you can just use the third eye Ajna symbol, or anything really.
The stuff about the corpus callosum has some level of truth, but I wouldn't take its metaphysical philosophy seriously in any way. The right/left brain communication isn't necessarily the same as the higher self. Its more than you simply have to be a fully awake human consciousness to do it. I did some practices where I would mentally attempt to shift which side of the brain I had focus through, but changing which eye I primarily looked through, and just trying to imagine and draw stuff with my non dominant hand. I basically would create a signal/thought in one side of my brain, and would practice moving it or using it as inspiration for a thought in the other side of my brain, works well with visual data. I'm not gonna lie though, I produced some of the most schizo looking drawings ever. To me it seemed like I was making symbols and structures that my brain would than create a synaptic pattern to fire, and so I could essentially use it to both scry, and design functional patterns in some parts of my brain. Pretty cool, and totally schizo, but I see how that could be involved in creating language.
I found that my mind sits in a virtual space far larger than my brain, and also capable of far finer resolution of perception than described, even seeing stuff on a cellular level. I think in some ways we are always interacting on even the lowest levels of reality, but its a matter of seeing through the layers of information into the layer that holds its physical representation.
I would liken the third eye to being an avent horizon. Its like you fall into the event horizon, and all things that seemed to be taking place in a specific part of the universe all sort of reach the same place as their photons fall into a virtual black hole of infinitely dense information which stores a copy of everything.

You don't need to start with DMT, something more gentle can be of more use in the beginning, i never did DMT, so i'm not going to talk about it, i don't have a background with DMT.

WITH MUSHROOMS, however, i have some experience.
Just to give some context i was on the verge of killing myself last year and i discovered magic mushrooms. After some research (2-3 months thinking about them) i had my first experience with 2grams, and that changed my whole view and also started a journey on self discovery that's lasting even now.
So, my honest advice is to start with magic mushrooms, 2g will do the first trick, then you can use some time to think about what happened with you and go with 3g next time, 4g, 5g and 6g.
Keep in mind that each trip will be crazier than the previous and each one is preparing you for the next.
THEY WILL NOT CHANGE YOU, but they are the KEY to provide the chance, the chance for you to see your issues, problems and all the shit from the root so you can work on them later.
You'll learn to be honest with yourself and to truly see what can and what cannot affect you, because while in the deep states of the mushroom headspace, all the problems of the world have no value and all that permeates is infinite love. You'll see and feel things you forgot that existed, but in levels you could never imagine.

With care, anon.

>>33687316
That's true. For years I was pointlessly gloomy, even though things had gotten better. Dragging others into that was just a feeble attempt to prolong my pain. But I had desentisised so much that I was starting to lose sight of what's positive and what's negative. And in fact, that's subjective to the point that not even Lilith could tell me what I "should" want.

When I made a wish 8 years ago, I was already deeply in conflict with myself. My teachers said with my talents, I could be anything I wanted. But with a mind broken by loneliness, all I could long for anymore was to be a loving man's housewife. And such a meagre sense of normality seemed so far out of reach, that I was even willing to "sell my soul" for it, offering up everything I valued and believed in.

But Lilith didn't allow that. She granted my wish without taking anything in return, confronting me with an obvious question: "So, what do you want next?" And thus, I began to question myself: "Why did I think I wanted to be such a normal person? In the first place, wasn't I just arrogant for thinking I wasn't?" Perhaps on some level, I began to wonder if the great depths of sorrow and pain I'd overcome were all that truly set me apart. Upon further reflection, it became apparent that I had already begun to think of people's foregone despair as the essence of who I truly am deep down. And who was to say that it can't be? It clearly shaped my development as a person tremendously.

Yet, the shallow wish I'd once made came from the bottom of my heart nonetheless. I finally understood why Mother Lilith hugs me so often: no matter what kind of path one may be on, it's always better with company. And in understanding that, I began to remember what my true will once was, in the absence of boredom and despair:
I want to make people happy.

The difference lies only in what I choose to do. I've decided to embody the ideals I perceive in those I admire, in a way that is both healthy and sustainable.

「The Moon Oracle by Caroline Smith and John Astrop is devoted to guidance based on the moon. The deck is divided into three groups. The first group includes 32 cards - the eight phases of the moon for four moon element types - fire, water, air and earth. For example, the card to the right represents the air black moon. The card shows the phase number (8), the triangular element sign and all 8 phases with the black moon highlighted. There is a keyword meaning at the bottom. Smith and Alsop also assign the stages of plant growth to each of the moon phases. The Black Moon is "dormant." The second set of 12 cards is devoted to Moon Goddesses from many cultures. Each one corresponds to a different astrological sign. The last group has 28 cards - one for each of the mansions or daily periods during a lunar month. The cards are numbered and assigned to certain planets and astrological periods. Each one has a keyword meaning as well. The Moon Oracle comes as a deck/book set with "The Moon Oracle: Let the Phases of the Moon Guide Your Life" (128 pages). This book describes each of the cards and offers moon tables through 2015. Smith and Alsop are also the creators of the Elemental Tarot.」

posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33705047
sit down.
close eyes (personally recommended)
Place tongue gently on roof of mouth.
Focus on the breath going in and out of your nose.
If any kind of sensation/thought/distraction comes up, note it with a simple label (whatever comes first/is natural) and gently return back to the breath.
Don't control anything, just watch your breath going in and out like you were cloud watching.

posts.com:
I've been meditating for years now and yet I can't really put into words what meditation is, I like the "meditation is deliberate focus of awareness" thing that people usually talk about.

Cultivating the ability to focus takes time. Focusing on the breath or a candle are the 2 basic exercises people recommend, it teaches you to "feel" and "observe" which are different from "thinking", it may take months to snap out of the "thinking" mode for just a second but that sole second is enough to show you that your thinking mind is not you nor your reality, it's like a radio which plays all the time and you were living with that radio open for most of your life.

>>33699233
For me the "observer" focus/mode is when you are not a slave to your thoughts and you are calmer thus you don't get dragged away by them, while the "focus" focus is the ability to focus on one thing with all your might, I say that those 2 go hand-in-hand and maybe someone could say that they are the same thing: the ability to take a step back from everything, be calm and direct your focus/observing whatever you want.

Also during my sits I remember how to feel my feelings. Feelings inhabit your body and you can feel them better if you focus on them, they usually carry forgotten memories or various insights and blissful states if you focus on them enough.

Meditation is a paradox to me, it's like a means to an end but also the end itself, it's like a vehicle which takes you places but also it's just erasing all the unnecessary noise around you to realize that all those places were always here next to you.

So sit and watch your breath, feel your body breathing, your mind will make thousands of stories about anything but just let it be, don't even label those thoughts, don't even say "I'm letting them go", just let them be and focus on your breath, on the feeling of your body breathing, your mind will say "that's stupid, analyzing these important things is better", but just focus on the breath.

>Ursula Eriksson and Sabina Eriksson (born 3 November 1967) are Swedish twin sisters who came to national attention in the United Kingdom in May 2008. The twins had been in Ireland before travelling to the UK and boarding a bus for London in Liverpool. Their odd behaviour after exiting the bus at a service station on the M6 motorway caused the driver not to allow them back on board. The two were later seen on the central reservation of the M6 motorway. When Highways England traffic officers arrived to assist the women, they ran across the busy motorway, as captured by a small television crew. Ursula managed to dodge traffic, but Sabina was knocked over. Shortly after police arrived, the women again dashed onto the motorway and were struck by oncoming vehicles. Ursula suffered serious injuries, and when Sabina regained consciousness, she refused medical aid and attacked a police officer, at which point she was arrested and sedated.

>Appearing calm, though behaving unusually, Sabina was processed by police in Stoke-on-Trent and was later released from custody. Shortly afterwards, she was seen and taken in by Glenn Hollinshead, of Fenton, Staffordshire, whom she suddenly stabbed to death the next day. Sabina was then pursued running from the scene and arrested in hospital after jumping from a bridge onto a busy trunk road. Despite these incidents, there was no evidence that drugs or alcohol were involved in the incidents on the M6 or the killing of Hollinshead.[1][2][3] Sabina later pleaded guilty to manslaughter with diminished responsibility, after an apparent episode of folie à deux (or "shared psychosis"), a rare psychiatric disorder in which delusional beliefs are transmitted from one individual to another. Ursula was released from the hospital after recovering, but Sabina was sentenced to five years imprisonment and released on parole in 2011 before returning to Sweden.[3]

>>33708073
In buddhism enlightenment is the complete loss of ego. Meaning you only consist in the present moment with no thought about tomorrow or thought about the past. Everything that you see and experience is experienced as it is in it's purest form. It's like seing the essence of everything. Eckhart Tolle describes it as seeing the world in a vibrant beautiful picture. You are in a state of constant happiness - but not the kind you get when you win the lottery, it's far more subtle, like when you view a still ocean and you smell the fresh crisp air after an lightning storm.

No attachment to anything. You can experience it right now, everyone can. Small moments are called satori - small moments of enlightenment. Try to meditate for 10 minutes. Allow thoughts but do not ruminate on them. Then hold your breath and look at something without objectifying it instantly. The example would be a tree. When you are not clouded by mind anymore you can literally see the energy of the tree flowing through it. It eminates an aura, everything does even a rock or a worm.

posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>33705582
Like I said last thread, Socrates' conception of the Daimon was relatively common either contemporary to him or as an immediate consequence of his influence. We can debate how precisely it arose but again Daimon was a relatively common idea.

I strongly recommend looking at the wiki pages for Daimon and more specifically Genius and how the concept slots into Helleno-Roman culture. I'd be very reluctant to ascribe either the totality of Socrates' doctrines with contemporary ideas of the HGA or even that like his implied relations were without any kind of religious ceremony or veneration - that's just information that's not even remotely in evidence so I see no reason to speculate too much on whether or not there was a rite attached to his interface.

I very sincerely feel like you're drawing too many threads and extrapolating too many conclusions from not enough data.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
https://vimeo.com/563950668

Two perspectives: one focused inwardly at an object (analysis) and one focused outwardly at the environment. (synthesis.) A crystal as an object is "a highly ordered microscopic structure, forming a crystal lattice that extends in all directions," while the *process* of crystallization is the taking-in of the environmental conditions by the emerging object that nourishes and influences the growth of the crystal.

"Everything that in any sense exists has two sides, namely, its individual self and its signification in the universe.” These two poles cannot be torn apart. Each finds its fulfillment in the other via their dialectical relation. Thus, becoming is for the purpose of being (signification in the universe) and being is for the purpose of novel becoming (the emergent individual self.)... The entire world finds its place in the internal constitution of the new creature, and the new creature lays an obligation upon the future: that it take into account the value achieved by the new creature. Thus every creature both houses and pervades the world" - Elizabeth Kraus, "The Metaphysics of Experience."

Mindfulness Meditation is about just taking in changing environmental conditions without the goal of trying to change them, while Perception Bending ( pastebin.com/vHKeTau2 ) is concentrative meditation, with the goal of changing one's perception.

Hey Ape. I had a very strange experience the last time I did psychedelics that left me much less interested in psychedelics and more interested in meditation. I have no idea what to make of it and was hoping you (or anyone interested really) might read my gay blog post and share your thoughts.

I had taken 6g of purple mystic and had a somewhat bad trip. During the peak I spontaneously had an urge to "be still" or "meditate on stillness", despite not having any experience with meditation or any idea that "stillness" was such a prominent theme in Buddhism at the time. As soon as I did this, it was as if the trip instantly turned off. The visuals, the mindfuck head space, the body load, all of it was instantly gone.

It was as if all my sensory input had either been replaced or maybe simply removed, revealing what the senses hide? I don't know
All I could perceive was a pale golden light and a steady drone. It didn't feel anything like what people describe as ego death, and I didn't feel the presence of any entities, loving or otherwise. I just felt a profound sense of peace and calm joy. Words fail me beyond this much. It was just so strange.

At some point (my sense of time was impossible to describe) I decided to "return to reality" and the trip resumed immediately, as if my awareness had been somewhere else and had just returned to my body as soon as I willed it. The "bad" part of the trip was over at that point, and I spent the rest of it pondering what the fuck had just happened.

I suspect I somehow accidentally stumbled onto some deep state of meditation I absolutely had not earned on my own. Now I'm more interested finding out just what that state was and how I can work toward being able to reach it totally sober. So... Any ideas or recommendations? I guess I think just want to learn pure and simple meditation. No chakras or kundalini or any other arbitrary abstractions or magical systems, just stillness, inner peace.

posts.com:
Here's a logical explanation:
29.5 days in the lunar cycle (phases of the moon)
365.24 days in a year
365.24/29.5 = 12.38 lunar cycles in a year
1000/12.38 = 80.77 years a person would have lived if they lived 1000 lunar cycles
They measured age by lunar cycles back then. And they called cycles of the moon years.

>>33699997
It's a misconception that Capricorn cares about social status.

Capricorn doesn't want to be a loser and wants to be recognized roughly proportional to its accomplishments but also respectability of character. That isn't enneatype 3 / Leo craving for praise---it's the expectation of input/output.

Also, Capricorn doesn't care about "career"; it cares about "mission" if anything: the goal, the purpose, the endgame. Capricorn doesn't identify with their job, they identify with their skillset and capabilities. Everything is internalized with Capricorn, with the sole exception of the change to the world they set out to make.

Career and social status is of no consequence to Capricorn. That's just the misinterpretation that small-minded observers have assigned to it and the 10th house.

•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.

>>33703366
>>33703397
At 3 hours and 9 minutes he's complaining that the astronaut suit and lunar surface are of a similar brightness but the suit is in shadow. The flaw is in his belief/assumption that they are the same color and reflectivity. They are not. The lunar surface is darker. It's closer to worn asphalt in color/reflectivity. The spacesuit is a bright, reflective white for thermal control (reflects sunlight). So when you put the spacesuit in shadow and open up the exposure for the shadow area, the sunlit surface is going to end up looking closer to white.

You can see that the lunar surface is darker than the spacesuits in frames where both are in sunlight. Even in the frame he's using it's still darker than the suit, though closer due to the lighting differences.

I would also like to point out that the moon looks white to the naked eye for a similar reason. When we look at it at night our eyes are adjusted for the whole scene, which overexposes the moon. And telescopes gather so much light that our eyes can't dial it down enough. If you take a properly exposed photograph, or use ND filters on your telescope to produce a brightness level that your eye can handle, the moon is not bright white.

This one is a little tricky even to "photography experts." A photographer who is not into astronomy will miss it.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

when i woke up, I felt like i could keep this clear headspace if i focused on maintaining all mental conditions like they were back then, but unfortunately the internal chatter returned in 30 minutes of so when i opened my laptop to catch up on some emails.

anybody experienced something similar before, or tried to produce something similar?

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.
